basics.name: Tanish Baranwal
basics.label: AI Researcher (Gap-Year, PhD-bound)
basics.summary: Freshly minted EECS (Berkeley ’25) grad spending a gap-year backpacking through research labs, hack-spaces and pickup-basketball courts while polishing PhD applications. My work lives at the intersection of self-supervised video learning, diffusion generative models and large-scale system design: from zero-shot point-tracking Gaussians at BAIR to LLM-powered catalog pipelines at Amazon, to 3-D cardiac wave synthesis at UCSF. I thrive on projects that blend algorithmic novelty with real-world impact, and I love mentoring small teams, writing clean PyTorch/JAX, and turning wild ideas into reproducible benchmarks.

work.name: Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research (BAIR)
work.summary: Exploring next-gen video generation & understanding with Prof. Jitendra Malik. Our focus: 3-D Gaussian tokens + masked autoencoding to learn dense temporal correspondences without labels.
highlights: Designed **Video Gaussian Masked Autoencoder (VG-MAE)** – 95 % masking, residual Gaussian deltas, explicit time-positional embeddings.
Achieved SOTA **zero-shot point tracking** on TAP-Vid Kinetics (+4.16 pp), DAVIS (+37.4 pp) and Kubric (+13.1 pp).
Led 4-person ablation squad; scaled training to 512 × 256 crops, 1 B frames on 128 A100s via FSDP + JAX pjit.
Primary author on NeurIPS 2025 submission; open-sourcing code & 10 TB synthetic dataset.

work.name: Amazon
work.summary: Built an LLM-driven footwear-size normalization pipeline for Amazon Fashion, converting messy global sizes into a unified US scale.
highlights: Prompt-engineered Bedrock‐Claude model achieving **85 % attribute accuracy** across 100 k SKUs; integrated human-in-loop feedback for long-tail edge cases.
Orchestrated **serverless ETL** (Step Functions + Lambda + EMR Spark) that now services a **100 M-item catalog** with <$0.03 / 1 k items compute cost.
Presented results to VP-level review; green-lit for 2026 roadmap.

work.name: eGolf.ai
work.summary: Bootstrapped a computer-vision platform that converts amateur golf swings into pro-level analytics.
highlights: Invented STFT + CNN pipeline predicting impact position, spin & carry within ±3 % of TrackMan benchmarks.
Built **AWS-native backend** (S3, DynamoDB, Lambda, API Gateway) serving 500 + users, 50 k sessions, 50 TB video.
Recruited & mentored 3 interns; filed **4 US patent applications** on pose-based swing analysis.

work.name: Cardiac Vision Labs, UCSF
work.summary: Pioneered diffusion models for 3-D cardiac excitation-wave synthesis; accelerated PDE solvers for arrhythmia simulation.
highlights: First-author **APL Machine Learning** paper detailing DDPMs that recreate scroll-wave dynamics (PMID 39364376, DOI 10.1063/5.0194391).
Wrote C++ / OpenMP kernel achieving **37 % speed-up** over baseline Aliev-Panfilov GPU solver on 128³ domains.
Presented findings at **Computing in Cardiology 2023**; invited talk for SIAM AN24 biomedical session.

publications.name: Dreaming of Electrical Waves: Generative Modeling of Cardiac Excitation Waves using Diffusion Models
publications.summary: Introduces diffusion generative models for realistic 3-D spiral/scroll waves; bridges data-driven AI and biophysics.

publications.name: Fault-Tolerant IoT System Using Software-Based “Digital Twin”
publications.publisher: IEEE 10th World Forum on Internet of Things
publications.summary: Proposes triplicated IoT topology augmented with software twins to sustain sensor faults at minimal cost.

publications.name: Quantitative Definition of Chemical Synthetic Pathway Complexity of Organic Compounds
Development of a Novel Machine-Learning Platform to Identify Structural Trends among NNRTI HIV-1 Reverse-Transcriptase Inhibitors
